intro: Sciaphila alba, commonly known as the white shadeplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines and Indonesia. This plant is characterized by its pale green to white leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in the shade. Sciaphila alba thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
